titlepage.titleproper: Inventory of the Imre Pozsgay papers
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California

defitem.label: Encoded by:
defitem.item: Machine-readable finding aid created by Martina Podsklanova.

titlepage.p: © 2010 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Documents relating to political conditions in Hungary during the communist and post-communist periods: speeches and writings, correspondence, notes, memoranda, reports, minutes, bulletins, serial issues, printed matter, and audiovisual materials.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Imre Pozsgay papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1996.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Studied at College of Horticulture, Fertőd, Hungary
Member of the Magyar Dolgozók Pártja, or MDP (the Hungarian Workers' Party, or HWP)
Studied at Lenin Institute, Budapest, Hungary; graduated from the Department of History and Marxism-Leninism
Member of the Magyar Szocialista Munkás Párt, or MSZMP (the Hungarian Socialist Workers' Party, or HSWP)
Leader of several sub-organizations within the HSWP Bács-Kiskun County Committee
Secretary, the HSWP Bács-Kiskun County Committee
Head of Press Section, HSWP Central Committee
Deputy Editor-in-Chief of the HSWP journal Társadalmi Szemle
Hungarian Deputy Minister of Education and Culture
Hungarian Minister of Education and Culture
Secretary General of the Hazafias Népfront, or HNF (the Patriotic Popular Front, or PPF)
Co-founder and deputy chairman of the Magyar Szocialista Párt, or MSZP (the Hungarian Socialist Party, or HSP)
Co-founder and later chairman of the Nemzeti Demokrata Szövetség, or NDSZ (National Democratic Union, or NDU)
Professor of Political Sciences, Debrecen University, Debrecen, Hungary
Rector of St. László University, Budapest

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to political conditions in Hungary during the communist and post-communist periods: speeches and writings, correspondence, notes, memoranda, reports, minutes, bulletins, serial issues, printed matter, and audiovisual materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into eight series. Most of the materials are arranged alphabetically and then chronologically.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Compiled news reports, circa 1985-1990: reports on news articles and other published materials, Hungarian and foreign, concerning mostly Hungarian issues or Imre Pozsgay; some contain compiled newspaper clippings

scopecontent.p: documents on interior and foreign affairs from Hungarian state institutions; the majority are Magyar Szocialista Munkás Párt Központi Bizottsága (MSZMP KB) and Magyar Szocialista Munkás Párt Politikai Bizottsága (MSZMP PB) documents; most of the documents are minutes of meetings, reports and correspondence

arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical and subsequently chronological order

arrangement.p: The series is organized into 13 subseries: VHS tapes and DVD discs, Photographs, Writings by or about Pozsgay, Államminiszter (Minister of State) file, István Bibó file, Hazafias Népfront documents, Magyar Demokrata Fórum documents, Magyarországi Szociáldemokrata Párt documents, Magyar Szocialista Munkás Párt documents, Magyar Szocialista Párt documents, Nemzeti Demokrata Szövetség documents, Országgyũlés (Parliament) file, and Miscellany. VHS tapes and DVD discs, and Photographs, are arranged generally in the original order. All other series are arranged chronologically and some also thematically.

scopecontent.p: Contains Pozsgay's presentations, interviews; a documentary entitled Szamizdatos évek; and a two-part documentary entitled 1956: A forradalom emlékezete
